document_data.caption: Divine minions of [[Horus-Re]] and [[Set]], in their human forms, stand before a minion of [[Geb]], transformed into its [[cave bear]] form.
document_data.name: Divine minion
document_data.challenge3e: +0 (divine minions of [[Anhur]], [[Hathor]], [[Isis]], [[Nephthys]], [[Sebek]], or [[Thoth]]); +1 (divine minions of [[Bast]], [[Geb]], [[Horus-Re]], [[Osiris]], or [[Set]])
document_data.mainbody: '''Divine minions''' were special servitors of the powers of the [[Mulhorandi pantheon]], who acted as their messengers and enforcers of their will. Most were created from the pantheon's [[petitioner]]s, but a few were [[celestial]]s or [[fiend]]s that had been bestowed additional power by a Mulhorandi deity.
document_data.Description:
In their base form, the majority of divine minions resembled a greatly well muscled and broad, [[Mulhorandi]] male or female warrior that stood over {{SI|6|ft|long=yes}} tall. They dressed in [[bronze]] [[plate mail]], decorated with the holy symbol of their deity. And they were armed with huge Mulhorandi weaponry, such as [[khopesh]]es, [[scimitar]]s, or [[two-handed sword]]s. These weapons were all forged in the [[Outer Planes]] and carried no greater than a ''+2 [[enchantment]]''. Whenever a divine minion died, they and all their possessions would disappear, with the body being reformed in the Outer Planes by their respective power.

Minions of [[Set]] stood out from the rest, wielding [[broadsword]]s or khopeshes<ref name ="PSCS-MS-pp.14-15" /> that were fashioned in [[Baator]],<ref name ="PSCS-MS-pp.14-15" /> and dressed in black, scaly plate mail.<ref name ="PSCS-MS-pp.14-15" />
document_data.Personality:
Nearly all divine minions were willing servitors of their respective Mulhorandi power, being fanatical followers willing to sacrifice their very lives to carry out the deity's will. They viewed their service as a great honor.  The minions of Set were the sole exception to this "willingness", as that power could unwillingly transform someone into one of his [[lawful evil]] minions. Though once transformed, they too were fanatical in carrying out Set's will.

Unless called by [[divine magic]] to serve a mortal, all but the divine minions of Set preferred not to be noticed by mortals. To this end, they preferred to not utilize their shape-shifting abilities unless absolutely necessary, viewing the revelation as something that would compromise their usefulness to their deity.<ref name ="PSCS-MS-pp.14-15" />

Animal Forms by Deity.Minions of [[Anhur]]: The servitors of this power could assume the form of a [[lion]].<ref>
Animal Forms by Deity.Minions of [[Bast]]: The servitors of this power could assume the form of a [[leopard]], a lion, or a small feral [[cat|domestic cat]].<ref>
Animal Forms by Deity.Minions of [[Geb]]: The servitors of this power could assume the form of either a [[cave bear]]<ref> or a [[brown bear]].
Animal Forms by Deity.Minions of [[Hathor]]: The servitors of this power could assume the form of a horned [[cow]].<ref>
Animal Forms by Deity.Minions of [[Horus-Re]]: The servitors of this power could assume the form of either a [[hawk]] or a lion.<ref>
Animal Forms by Deity.Minions of [[Isis]]: The servitors of this power could assume the form of a hawk.<ref>
Animal Forms by Deity.Minions of [[Nephthys]]: The servitors of this power could assume the form of a hawk, a [[crocodile]],
Animal Forms by Deity.Minions of [[Osiris]]: The servitors of this power could assume the form of either a [[bear]] or a hawk.<ref>
Animal Forms by Deity.Minions of [[Set]]: The servitors of this power could typically assume the form of various types of [[giant snake]]s,<ref name ="PSCS-MS-pp.14-15" /> including a [[giant poisonous snake]], a [[giant scorpion]],<ref name ="PSCS-MS-pp.14-15" /> a cave bear, a giant crocodile, or a [[giant hyena]].<ref name ="PSCS-MS-pp.14-15" />
Animal Forms by Deity.Minions of [[Sebek]]: The servitors of this power could assume the form of either a crocodile
Animal Forms by Deity.Minions of [[Thoth]]: The servitors of this power could assume the form of either a [[baboon]] or an [[ibis]].<ref>

Society.Diet: These creatures required no food or drink to sustain themselves. However, the type of food they preferred varied depending upon which deity they served. The minions of Set for example, had particularly carnivorous tastes.<ref name ="PSCS-MS-pp.14-15" />
Society.Homelands:
Hundreds of divine minions could be found within the residence of each Mulhorandi power's [[avatar|mortal incarnation]], wherever that may be, such as in the towers of [[Skuld]]. And according to the [[World Tree cosmology]], when divine minions were not carrying out the will of their deities on the [[Prime Material plane]] they typically resided within the [[Neutral Planes|Neutral Plane]] of [[Heliopolis]]. 

In the [[Great Wheel cosmology]], the divine minions of Set were said to reside with him in Baator.<ref name ="PSCS-MS-pp.14-15" /> While in the World Tree model, they were said to reside with him in Heliopolis.

document_data.History: After the Mulhorandi pantheon landed in ''[[Matet]]'' upon the [[Godswatch Mountains]], having traveled to [[Realmspace]] to free the [[Mulan]] people from bondage under the [[Imaskari Empire]], they created mortal incarnations. These went and traveled among the Mulan, transforming the most truly faithful among them into divine minions. When the Mulan eventually rose up against their Imaskari oppressors there were hundreds of divine minions, who went on to fight and die in their rebellion.
document_data.Notable Divine Minions:
* Prior to the [[Time of Troubles]], a company of six disguised minions of Anhur traveled across Mulhorand with their power's mortal incarnation, [[Hethhab]].<ref>
* Several divine minions of Horus-Re guarded the tomb of the [[pharaoh]] [[Horuseres II]] at all times.<ref>
* [[Thah Rahalar]], a divine minion of Set that had been unwillingly transformed from a jackal-headed, [[hound archon]] servitor of Nephthys.
